recipe.name: Duck Breasts With Pineapple-Scallion Sauce
recipe.description: Crispy-skinned duck breasts paired with a sweet and tangy pineapple-scallion sauce, perfect for a sophisticated dinner.
steps: In a medium saucepan, combine pineapple preserves, pineapple juice, soy sauce, paprika, ½ teaspoon salt, and chili flakes.
Simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes until the preserves melt. Remove from heat and stir in scallions. Set aside to cool.
Pat duck breasts dry. Score the skin in a cross-hatch pattern, taking care not to pierce the flesh. Season both sides with 1 teaspoon salt. Apply Poultry Seasoning to the flesh side only.
Place duck breasts skin-side down in a cold, oven-safe skillet. Cook over high heat for 10 minutes to render fat.
Reduce heat to medium and cook for 5 minutes until the skin is golden and crispy. Drain excess fat as needed.
Flip the breasts and sear the flesh side for 3–4 minutes. Sear the sides for about 1 minute each.
Transfer the skillet to the oven, flesh-side down, and bake for 5–6 minutes to an internal temperature of 135°F for medium doneness.
Remove the duck breasts from the oven and let them rest for 5 minutes before slicing into 1-inch pieces.
Serve sliced duck breasts with the pineapple-scallion sauce, warmed slightly if needed.
A little effort, a lot of flavor—dig in and savor!
